bitfield.description: Defines the increment value when compensation is active
Defines the default increment value
Counter enable 0: Disables the counter. The counter maintains the current count. 1: Enables the counter.
Counter overflow status. 0: No overflow 1: Overflow occurred

Compensation counter. Read returns the current COMPEN_CNT value. 0: Compensation is disabled and counter will increment by DEFAULT_INC. n: Compensation is enabled until COMPEN_CNT decrements to 0. The COMPEN_CNT value decrements on every iep_clk cycle. When COMPEN_CNT is greater than 0, then count value increments by CMP_INC. NOTE: SLOW_COMPEN_CNT MUST be set to zero IF COMPEN_CNT is not.

Slow compensation counter. Write: 0x0: Slow compensation is disabled and counter will increment by DEFAULT_INC 0xn: Compensation is enabled for 1 count for every SLOW_COMPEN_CNT cycle, this is free running and continuous until software clears the MMR. For example, SLOW_COMPEN_CNT = 16, every 16 clock cycles the compensation value is used for 1 count. Note COMPEN_CNT MUST be set to zero IF SLOW_COMPEN_CNT is not zero. Read: Software can read the number of cycles left until the compensation event. For example, software writes SLOW_COMPEN_CNT = 0x100 and reads SLOW_COMPEN_CNT = 0x7. This means in 6 more IEP_CLK cycles before the counter reaches 0x1 for the compensation event. If software writes SLOW_COMPEN_CNT = 0x8000 before compensation event, then the counter will reset to 0x8000.
64-bit count value (lower 32-bits). Increments by (DEFAULT_INC or CMP_INC) on every positive edge of PRUSS_IEP_CLK (200MHz).
64-bit count value (upper 32-bits). Increments by (DEFAULT_INC or CMP_INC) on every positive edge of PRUSS_IEP_CLK (200MHz).

Enable the double flop synchronization of the capture inputs to the PRUSS_IEP_CLK/PRUSS_GICLK. cap_async_en[n] = 0 Disable/Bypass the double flop synchronization cap_async_en[n] = 1 Enable the double flop synchronization

Capture 1st Event Enable for cap[7] fall 0: Continues mode Status not set Capture time on every event 1: First Event mode Status set on First Event Capture time on First Event, hold until time is read

Capture 1-st Event Enable for cap[7] rise 0: Continues mode Status not set Capture time on every event 1: First Event mode Status set on First Event Capture time on First Event, hold until time is read

Capture 1-st Event Enable for cap[6] fall 0: Continues mode Status not set Capture time on every event 1: First Event mode Status set on First Event Capture time on First Event, hold until time is read

Capture 1-st Event Enable for cap[6] rise 0: Continues mode Status not set Capture time on every event 1: First Event mode Status set on First Event Capture time on First Event, hold until time is read
Capture 1-st Event Enable for n 0: Continues mode Status not set Capture time on every event 1: First Event mode Status set on First Event Capture time on First Event, hold until time is read
Capture RAW/Current Status cap_rawn 0: Current state is low for capn 1: Current state is high for capn
A Capture Valid Status , OR tree 0: No Hit for any cap event 1: Hit for 1 or more cap event is pending
Capture Fall Valid Status for PRUSS_IEP_CAPTURE_FALL07 0: No Hit, no capture event occurred 1: Hit, capture event occurred Clr on read when it’s Capture Value is read CAP*_REG
Capture Rise Valid Status for PRUSS_IEP_CAPTURE_RISE07 0: No Hit, no capture event occurred 1: Hit, capture event occurred Clr on read when it’s Capture Value is read CAP*_REG
Capture Fall Valid Status for PRUSS_IEP_CAPTURE_FALL06 0: No Hit, no capture event occurred 1: Hit, capture event occurred Clr on read when it’s Capture Value is read CAP*_REG
Capture Rise Valid Status for PRUSS_IEP_CAPTURE_RISE06 0: No Hit, no capture event occurred 1: Hit, capture event occurred Clr on read when it’s Capture Value is read CAP*_REG

Capture Rise Valid Status capr_validn maps PRUSS_IEP_CAPRn_REG, where n=0 to 5, 0: No Hit, no capture event occurred 1: Hit, capture event occurred Clr on read when it’s Capture Value is read CAP*_REG
Capture Value for capture rise i event low
Capture Value for capture rise i event low
Capture Value for capture rise i event low
Capture Value for capture rise i event low
Capture Value for capture rise i event low
Capture Value for capture rise i event low
Capture Value for capture rise i event high

Capture Value for capture rise i event high
Capture Value for capture rise i event high
Capture Value for capture rise i event high
Capture Value for capture rise i event high
Capture Value for capr6 (rise) event low
Capture Value for capr6 (rise) event high
Capture Value for capf6 (fall) event low
Capture Value for capf6 (fall) event high
Capture Value for capr7 (rise) event low
Capture Value for capr7 (rise) event high
Capture Value for capf7 (fall) event low
Capture Value for capf7 (fall) event high
Enable bits for each of the compare registers CMP_EN =0 : Disables CMPj/k Event CMP_EN=1: Enables CMPj/k Event CMP_EN[0] (bit 1 of register) maps to CMP0 event
Enable the reset of the counter 0: Disable 1: Enable the reset of the counter if a CMP0 event occurs

Status bit for each of the compare registers 'Match' indicates the current counter is greater than or equal to the compare value. Note it is the firmware's responsibility to handle the IEP overflow. CMP_HIT&lt;n&gt; = 0: No match has occured CMP_HIT&lt;n&gt; = 1: A match occured. The associated hardware event signal will assert and remain high until the status is cleared.

register.description: RXIPG0 This register can be used to determine the last RX IPG and the smallest RX IPG. RXIPG0 is the status for the RX port which is attached to PRU0.

bitfield.description: Defines the current minimum number of PRUSS_GICLK/PRUSS_IEP_CLK cycles that is RXDV is sampled low. It stores the current smallest RX_IPG The value can be read at any time. It gets updated after RX_IPG update if RX_MIN_IPG &gt; RX_IPG. Do to sync flop the value can be off by 2 PRUSS_GICLK/PRUSS_IEP_CLK cycles plus some small additional errors do to rise/fall delay error (&lt;5 ns) Any write will reset this bitfield to 0xffff

Defines the current number of PRUSS_GICLK/PRUSS_IEP_CLK cycles that is RXDV is sampled low. Read: n = n number of PRUSS_GICLK cycles RXDV is sampled low. It can be read at any time. It will saturate at 0xffff It gets updated after RXDV goes low to high Do to sync flop the value can be off by 2 PRUSS_GICLK/PRUSS_IEP_CLK cycles plus some small additional errors do to rise/fall delay error (&lt;5 ns)

register.description: RXIPG1This register can be used to determine the last RX IPG and the smallest RX IPG. RXIPG1 is the status for the RX port which is attached to PRU1

bitfield.description: Defines the current minimum number of PRUSS_GICLK/PRUSS_IEP_CLK cycles that is RXDV is sampled low. It stores the current smallest RX_IPG The value can be read at any time. It gets updated after RX_IPG update if RX_MIN_IPG &gt; RX_IPG. Do to sync flop the value can be off by 2 PRUSS_GICLK/PRUSS_IEP_CLK cycles plus some small additional errors do to rise/fall delay error (&lt;5 ns) Any write will reset this bitfield to 0xffff

Defines the current number of PRUSS_GICLK/PRUSS_IEP_CLK cycles that is RXDV is sampled low. Read: n = n number of PRUSS_GICLK cycles RXDV is sampled low. It can be read at any time. It will saturate at 0xffff It gets updated after RXDV goes low to high Do to sync flop the value can be off by 2 PRUSS_GICLK/PRUSS_IEP_CLK cycles plus some small additional errors do to rise/fall delay error (&lt;5 ns)

Reset value (lower 32-bits). This register enables SW to define the reset state of the Master Counter, which can be reset by the following events (if enabled): CMP0 event; PWM0_SYNC_OUT event; PWM3_SYNC_OUT event. The RESET_VAL should be in increments of the DEFAULT_INC (default state is 5). For example, 0x0000_000A.

Reset value (upper 32-bits). This register enables SW to define the reset state of the Master Counter, which can be reset by the following events (if enabled): CMP0 event; PWM0_SYNC_OUT event; PWM3_SYNC_OUT event. The RESET_VAL should be in increments of the DEFAULT_INC (default state is 5). For example, 0x0000_000A.
The raw status bit of pwm3_sync_out event. 0x0: No pwm3_sync_out event 0x1: pwm3_sync_out event occurred Write 1 to Clear.

Enable the reset of the counter by a pwm3_sync_out event. 0x0: Disable 0x1: Enable the reset of the counter if a pwm3_sync_out event occurs Notes: input must be high for &gt; 10ns to ensure reset event occurs , if less it might not occur. The rising edge event causes the reset after delay of 5 to 15ns. To reset again, it must go low for &gt; 100ns. If the low pulse is less, a 2nd reset event may not occur.
The raw status bit of pwm0_sync_out event. 0x0: No pwm0_sync_out event 0x1: pwm0_sync_out event occurred Write 1 to Clear

Enable the reset of the counter by a pwm0_sync_out event. 0x0: Disable 0x1: Enable the reset of the counter if a pwm0_sync_out event occurs Notes: input must be high for &gt; 10ns to ensure reset event occurs , if less it might not occur. The rising edge event causes the reset after delay of 5 to 15ns. To reset again, it must go low for &gt; 100ns. If the low pulse is less, a 2nd reset event may not occur.
SYNC1 independent mode enable. Independent mode means the SYNC1 signal can be different from SYNC0. 0h: Dependent mode 1h: Independent mode
SYNC1 single shot or cyclic/auto generation mode enable 0h: Disable, single shot mode 1h: Enable, cyclic generation mode

SYNC1 acknowledgement mode enable 0h: Disable, SYNC1 will go low after pulse width is met. 1h: Enable, SYNC1 will remain asserted until receiving software acknowledges by reading PRUSS_IEP_SYNC1_STAT which clears on read.
SYNC0 single shot or cyclic/auto generation mode enable 0h: Disable, single shot mode 1h: Enable, cyclic generation mode

SYNC0 acknowledgement mode enable 0h: Disable, SYNC0 will go low after pulse width is met. 1h: Enable, SYNC0 will remain asserted until receiving software acknowledges by reading PRUSS_IEP_SYNC0_STAT which clears on read.
SYNC1 generation enable 0: Disable SYNC1 generation. If SYNC1 is low, it will stop immediately If SYNC1 is high, it will stop after SYNC1 goes low 1: Enable SYNC1 generation
SYNC0 generation enable 0: Disable SYNC0 generation. If SYNC0 is low, it will stop immediately If SYNC0 is high, it will stop after SYNC0 goes low 1: Enable SYNC0 generation

SYNC generation enable 0: Disable the generation and clocking of SYNC0 and SYNC1 logic. If SYNC0 AND SYNC1 is low, it will stop immediately If SYNC0 OR SYNC1 is high, it will stop after SYCN0 AND SYNC1 goes low Note that you might get 1 extra high pulse if this is disabled during a high pulse of one and the 2nd pulse goes high before the last pulse low if you do not de-assert sync0_en and sync1_en at the same time. SW should always de-assert both sync1_en and sync0_en at the same time as sync_en is de-asserted 1: Enables SYNC0 and SYNC1 function
SYNC1 First Event status 0: SYNC1 first event has NOT occurred 1: SYNC1 first event has occurred. This bits is cleared when sync1_en = 0
SYNC0 First Event status 0: SYNC0 first event has not occurred 1: SYNC0 first event has occurred. This bits is cleared when sync0_en = 0
SYNC0 pending state 0: SYNC0 is not pending 1 SYNC0 is pending or has occurred in none ack mode Wr '1' to clear
SYNC1 pending state 0: SYNC1 is not pending 1 SYNC1 is pending or has occurred in none ack mode Write '1' to Clear

Defines the number of clock cycles SYNC0/1 will be high. Note if SYNC0/1 is disabled during pulse width time (that is, SYNC_CTRL[SYNC0_EN | SYNC1_EN | SYNC_EN] = 0), the ongoing pulse will be terminated. 0x0 : 1 clock cycle. 0x1 : 2 clock cycles. N : N+1 clock cycles.
This defines the period of rise SYNC0 -&gt; rise SYNC0 0x0: Reserved 0x1: 2 clk cycles period N: N+1 clk cycles period

When SYNC1_IND_EN = 0, defines number of clock cycles from the start of SYNC0 to the start of SYNC1. Note this is the delay before the start of SYNC1. 0h: No delay 1h: 1 clock cycle delay. Nh: N clock cycles delay. When SYNC1_IND_EN = 1, defines the period between the rising edges of SYNC1. 0h: Reserved. 1h: 2 clock cycles period. Nh: N+1 clock cycles period
Defines the start time after the activation event. 0h: 1 clock cycle delay. Nh: N+1 clock cycles delay.
Define the number of iep_clk cycles Per WD clock event 0x4e20/20000 gives a rate of 100 us if iep_clk is at 200MHz. Write operation will cause the pre-divider to reset to zero.

Define the number of WD ticks for PDI WD 0x03e8 (default) value gives a rate of 100 ms if pre_divider set to 100 uS Exp Actions: Inc exp counter, clr status The counter will reset on these events software Wrt or DIGIO Data In capture

Define the number of WD ticks for PD WD, used for All SyncManagers software operations 0x03e8 (default) value gives a rate of 100 ms if pre_divider set to 0x100 us Watchdog is restarted with every write access to Sync Mangers with Watchdog Trigger Enable Bit Set Exp actions: Inc exp counter, clr status DIGIO Data out forced to zero if pr1_edio_oe_ext = 1 and PRUSS_IEP_DIGIO_EXT.sw_data_out_update = 0 The counter will reset on these events software Wrt
WD PDI status. 0h: Expired (PDI_WD_EXP event generated) 1h: Active or disabled
WD PD status (triggered by Sync Mangers status). 0h: Expired (PD_WD_EXP event generated) 1h: Active or disabled
WD PD expiration counter. Counter increments on every PD time out and stops at FFh
WD PDI expiration counter. Counter increments on every PDI time out and stops at FFh.
Watchdog PDI 0: Disable 1: Enable
Watchdog PD 0: Disable 1: Enable

Data Out is updated at: 0b00: PRU0/1_RX_EOF 0b01: Reserved 0b10: DC SYNC0 event 0b11: DC SYNC1 event If outvalid_mode is set, then output data is forced zero if PD_WD_EXP from the WD block and PR1_EDIO_OE_EXT is 1

Defines event that triggers data in to be sampled 0b00: PRU0/1_RX_SOF 0b01: Rising edge of external pr&lt;k&gt;-edio_latch_in signal 0b10: DC rising edge of SYNC0 event 0b11: DC rising edge of SYNC1 event
Watchdog behavior 0: Outputs are reset immediately after watchdog expires 1: Outputs are reset with next output event that follows watchdog expiration

Indicates the digital input/output direction. DUE TO INTEGRATION, ACTUAL MODE IS UNIDIRECTIONAL IN THIS DEVICE. 0: Unidirectional mode: input/output direction of pins configured individually 1: Bidirectional mode: all I/O pins are bidirectional, direction configuration is ignored

Defines OUTVALID mode 0: Output event signaling 1: Process Data Watchdog trigger (WD_TRIG) signaling on OUTVALID pin (see SyncManager). Output data is forced zero if PD_WD_EXP from the WD block and PR1_EDIO_OE_EXT is 1
Indicates OUTVALID polarity 0: Active High 1: Active Low

Data input. Sample time of digital inputs is controlled externally by using the pr&lt;k&gt;_edio_latch_in signal. Must enable by settingPRUSS_IEP_DIGIO_CTRL[5:4] IN_MODE. Only [7:0] are exported to device pins in this device.
Raw Data Input. Direct sample of EDIO_DATA_IN[31:0]. Only [7:0] are exported to device pins in this device.
Data Output
Enables tri-state control for pr&lt;k&gt;_edio_data_out[7:0].
Defines which RX_EOF is used for PR1_EDIO_DATA_IN[31:0] capture 0: PRU0_RX_EOF 1: PRU1_RX_EOF
Defines which RX_SOF is used for PR1_EDIO_DATA_IN[31:0] capture 0: PRU0_RX_SOF 1: PRU1_RX_SOF
Define the number of iep_clk (PRUSS_IEP_CLK) cycle delay of SOF PR1_EDIO_DATA_IN[31:0] capture
Define the number of iep_clk (PRUSS_IEP_CLK) cycle delay on assertion of PR1_EDIO_OUTVALID. Min is 2 clock cycles. Max is 16 clock cycles
When OUTVALID_OVR_EN is set then PR1_EDIO_OUTVALID = SW_OUTVALID
Enable software to control value of pr&lt;k&gt;_edio_data_out[7:0] 0: Disable 1: Enable
Enable PRUSS_DIGIO_DATA_OUT to be driven out on pr&lt;k&gt;_edio_data_out. Only valid if OUTVALID_OVR_EN = 1. 0: Disable 1: Enable
